title: A Bayesian observer model constrained by efficient coding can explain anti-Bayesian percepts
background: Perception studies often separate efficient coding (representation constraints) from Bayesian decoding (inference from noisy measurements).
problem_gap: Standard Bayesian models with symmetric likelihood commonly predict attraction to prior, but psychophysics often reports repulsive biases.
why_this_study: To unify encoding constraints and decoding in one observer model and test whether anti-Bayesian-looking behavior can emerge from Bayesian inference under realistic encoding.

title: A unifying theory explains seemingly contradictory biases in perceptual estimation
background: Recent work revisits contradictory perceptual bias findings and seeks one explanatory principle.
problem_gap: Different paradigms report attractive vs repulsive effects without a single accepted account.
why_this_study: To provide a unified account tying noise assumptions, prior geometry, and decoder behavior.

title: Finding Structure in Time
background: Humans infer latent temporal regularities from sequential input.
problem_gap: Mechanistic links between observed behavior and latent structure representations remained underspecified.
why_this_study: To characterize how temporal structure is discovered and represented during learning.
